    OnDirty ="[Event Procedure]"
    GUID = Begin
        0x9eaeb15ccba6bb44841e8888510684a7
    End
    RecordSource ="SELECT Other_Persons.OPID, Other_Persons.PID, Persons.TP, Persons.FNAME, Persons"
        ".MI, Persons.LNAME, Persons.HOME_PHONE, Persons.CID, Persons.WORK_PHONE, Persons"
        ".EXTENSION, Persons.ADDR1, Persons.ADDR2, Persons.CITY, Persons.STATE, Persons.Z"
        "IP, Persons.SALUTATION, Persons.LAST_CHG, Persons.EMAIL, Persons.CELL_PHONE, Per"
        "sons.FAX_PHONE, Persons.MAILPREF, Persons.SPECIAL, Persons.COMMENTS AS P_Comment"
        ", Persons.Temp AS P_Temp, Other_Persons.TP AS OP_TP, Other_Persons.OTH, Other_Pe"
        "rsons.SCH_CODE, Other_Persons.Comment AS O_Comment, Other_Persons.Temp AS O_Temp"
        ", Other_Persons.Category, Other_Persons.Grade, Other_Persons.Paid, Other_Persons"
        ".Parent_or_Teacher FROM Persons RIGHT JOIN (Other_Persons LEFT JOIN Schools ON O"
        "ther_Persons.SCH_CODE=Schools.SCH_CODE) ON Persons.PID=Other_Persons.PID; "
    OnCurrent ="[Event Procedure]"
    OnDelete ="[Event Procedure]"
    BeforeUpdate ="[Event Procedure]"
    AfterUpdate ="[Event Procedure]"
    OnClose ="[Event Procedure]"

                    Name ="cbFindName"
                    RowSourceType ="Table/Query"
                    RowSource ="SELECT Other_Persons.OPID, Persons.LNAME & \", \" & [FNAME] & \" \" & [MI] & \" "
                        "\" & [SALUTATION] & \" (\" & Persons.TP & \")\" AS OName FROM Persons RIGHT JOIN"
                        " Other_Persons ON Persons.PID=Other_Persons.PID WHERE (((Other_Persons.TP)=Forms"
                        "![xOtherPersons Edit Add Delete]!OP_TP)) ORDER BY Persons.LNAME & \", \" & [FNAM"
                        "E] & \" \" & [MI] & \" \" & [SALUTATION] & \" (\" & Persons.TP & \")\"; "
                    ColumnWidths ="0;2592"

                    OnEnter ="[Event Procedure]"

                        "ther_Persons.TP)=Forms![xOtherPersons Edit Add Delete]!OP_TP)) ORDER BY Persons."

                        "ion] & \"  (\" & [TP] & \")\" AS PName FROM Persons ORDER BY [LNAME] & \", \" & "

                        "s.TP)=\"PS\" Or (PersonsTypes.TP)=\"PT\" Or (PersonsTypes.TP)=\"ET\" Or (Persons"
                        "Types.TP)=\"RJ\" Or (PersonsTypes.TP)=\"TH\" Or (PersonsTypes.TP)=\"AD\")=False)"

                    Name ="Paid"
                    ControlSource ="Paid"
                    StatusBarText ="Student and Teacher Workshops"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0x3267f2093d72224eb9b15d32d6ba679e
                    End

                    LayoutCachedLeft =3420
                    LayoutCachedTop =3000
                    LayoutCachedWidth =4860
                    LayoutCachedHeight =3255
                    Begin
                        Begin Label
                            OverlapFlags =247
                            Left =2820
                            Top =3000
                            Width =435
                            Height =240
                            Name ="Label133"
                            Caption ="Paid:"
                            GUID = Begin
                                0x0b71634d74077a4ca563250ad74462bd
                            End
                            LayoutCachedLeft =2820
                            LayoutCachedTop =3000
                            LayoutCachedWidth =3255
                            LayoutCachedHeight =3240
                        End
                    End
                End
                Begin TextBox
                    OverlapFlags =247
                    IMESentenceMode =3
                    Left =1080
                    Top =3000
                    Height =255
                    TabIndex =40
                    Name ="Category"
                    ControlSource ="Category"
                    StatusBarText ="Student Workshop Category"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0x2fafb069144cbd45a4f8d7f2767bbfc1
                    End

                    LayoutCachedLeft =1080
                    LayoutCachedTop =3000
                    LayoutCachedWidth =2520
                    LayoutCachedHeight =3255
                    Begin
                        Begin Label
                            OverlapFlags =247
                            Left =180
                            Top =3000
                            Width =810
                            Height =240
                            Name ="Label134"
                            Caption ="Category:"
                            GUID = Begin
                                0x9fea29ec5131d84ab46104fbe36c67e3
                            End
                            LayoutCachedLeft =180
                            LayoutCachedTop =3000
                            LayoutCachedWidth =990
                            LayoutCachedHeight =3240
                        End
                    End
                End
                Begin Label
                    OverlapFlags =85
                    Left =7620
                    Top =480
                    Width =2310
                    Height =210
                    Name ="Label135"
                    Caption ="<-list from Table PersonsTypes"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0xfcb903d03af62d4bb3e6174ed7fc1c1a
                    End
                    LayoutCachedLeft =7620
                    LayoutCachedTop =480
                    LayoutCachedWidth =9930
                    LayoutCachedHeight =690
                End
            End
        End
    End
End
CodeBehindForm
Attribute VB_GlobalNameSpace = False
Attribute VB_Creatable = True
Attribute VB_PredeclaredId = True
Attribute VB_Exposed = False
'    SciFairMaster.mdb  (All class objects and modules)
'
'    Copyright (C) 2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013,
'                  2014  Dennis e.Spanogle
'
'    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
'    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
'    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
'    (at your option) any later version.
'
'    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
'    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
'    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
'    GNU General Public License for more details.
'
'    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
'    along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
Option Compare Database
Option Explicit
Private HoldCRCState As Boolean ' current state of 'Confirm Record Change' option
Private personsRS As Recordset
Private dbSciFair As Database
Private criteria As String
Private msg As String
Private Title As String
Private DidDelete As Boolean
Private DeletePID As Long
Private deleteOPID As Long
Private DidAdd As Boolean
Private DidPersonAdd As Boolean
Dim NewPID As Long
Private ctlPrevFocus As Control
Private DirtyCount As Integer
Private tOPID As Long
Private tLNAME As String
Private tFNAME As String
Private CurrentTP As String
Private NoEditorChange As Boolean
Private Sub cbFindName_AfterUpdate()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If IsNull(Me.cbFindName) Then Exit Sub
   ' Find the record that matches the control.
   Me.Recordset.FindFirst "[OPID] = " & Str(Me![cbFindName])
   'Dim rs As Object
   'Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
   'rs.FindFirst "[JUN] = " & str(Me![cbFindName])
   'Me.Bookmark = rs.Bookmark
   cbFindName = Null
   'Me.STATUS.SetFocus
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindName_Enter()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If DidDelete = True Then
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     'Me.cbJUN.Requery
     DidDelete = False
   End If
   If DidAdd = True Then
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     'Me.cbJUN.Requery
     DidAdd = False
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub cbOP_TP_AfterUpdate()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   '  User is about to change the editor for another type person?
   ' see if have done edits or in new add
   If Me.Dirty Then
   ' if so see if complete data (i.e. must have pid assigned)
     If IsNull(Me.cbPerson) Then
       ' user did not abandon change in 'cbOP_TP_Enter so just clear fields and go
       ' Two undos will clear all fields and allow an exit without update
       DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, acUndo, , acMenuVer70
       On Error Resume Next  ' incase two are not needed
       DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, acUndo, , acMenuVer70
       On Error GoTo SubError
     Else  ' did add or had an edit. so need to force an update while still
           ' the currentTP and editor
       Me.Requery  ' This completes the edit or add
     End If
   End If
   ' At this time all the updates should be done for the previous Edit Type
   ' the focus could have been changed by the above requery so get it back
   Me.cbOP_TP.SetFocus
   ' *****************ALL SET TO CHANGE THE EDITOR AT THIS POINT*******
   CurrentTP = Me.cbOP_TP
   lblType.Caption = Me.cbOP_TP.Text & " Edit, Add, Delete"
   CurrentDb().Properties("LastOtherPersonType") = CurrentTP
   ' if cbperson is null and any other field is set then
   '  next line will attempt to save the record of the
   '   previous new  entry that was not completed, then causes an error.
   '    That is why se do the acUndo stuff above
   ' This causes a call to form.current
   Me.Filter = "OP_TP = '" & CurrentTP & "'"
   If Me.Recordset.EOF Then
     MsgBox "No Entries for Person Type " & CurrentTP & vbCrLf & _
          "Enter First person now OR.. select different Editor"
   Else
    ' populate the recordset and get the number of records
     Me.Recordset.MoveLast
     Me.Recordset.MoveFirst
   End If
   ' update the searchfield for this recordset
   Me.cbFindName.Requery
   Me.LbOTH_NAME.Caption = Me.cbOP_TP.Column(2)
   Me.LbOPType.Caption = Me.cbOP_TP.Column(1) & " Persons Information"
  If CurrentTP = "AS" Then
    Me.cbSchool.SetFocus
  Else
    Me.OTH.SetFocus
  End If
  Me.cbOP_TP = Null
  Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description & ", #" & Err.Number
End Sub

Private Sub cbOP_TP_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
  
End Sub

Private Sub cbOP_TP_Click()
   On Error GoTo SubError

   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description

End Sub

Private Sub cbOP_TP_Enter()
  On Error GoTo SubError
   If Me.Dirty Then
   ' if so see if complete data (i.e. must have pid assigned)
     If IsNull(Me.cbPerson) Then
       If MsgBox("About to abandon Prev Editor without Adding the New Person" & vbCrLf & _
              "Do you want to change?", vbYesNo, "Editor Change") = vbNo Then
         'set flag for afterupdate
         NoEditorChange = True
         Me.TimerInterval = 50 ' use this to change focus back to persons
       Else
        
       End If
     End If
   End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub cbPerson_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
   ' this routine not called if notinlist response is acDataErrContinue
   ' I.E. if added a new name with ; or if fixname (changed string)
   ' User selected existing Person for a New record (only way to get here)
   ' The person selected could already be in ASTA etc.  This would not be
   ' a good thing so I will not allow it.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Dim rs As Object
   Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone   ' get all current ASTA or whatever selected
       ' in CurrentTP
   rs.FindFirst "[PID] = " & cbPerson.Value 'contains the PID of seleced person
   If rs.NoMatch Then
      ' Find just continue
   Else
      MsgBox "Already Entered!" & vbCrLf & _
             "Select a different Person", vbOKOnly, Title
      'MsgBox "oldvalue = " & IIf(IsNull(Me.cbPerson.OldValue), "null", Me.cbPerson.OldValue)
      Cancel = True
      Exit Sub
   End If
   '  The code below must also be in cbPerson_NotInList for acDataErrContinue return
   If IsNull(OP_TP) Then
     OP_TP = CurrentTP
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   '  Do this code for new adds  - need  defaults set
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Dim JuNum As Integer
   Dim ii As Integer
  'If IsNull(OP_TP) Then
  '  OP_TP = CurrentTP
  'End If
   Exit Sub
   
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub


Private Sub Form_Timer()
  ' This moves to the next object in the case a persons was added to cbPerson
  ' that was not orgionally typed or in case the orgional string had a ';'
  ' SEE cbPerson_NotInList
    ' Discovered why vbESC, Chr(27) etc do not work. Since they are
  ' non printing characters, they must be enclosed in brackets
  ' i.e.  SendKeys {vbKeyEscape}  etc.  Note addere rev 1.0.8

  On Error GoTo SubError
  If NoEditorChange = True Then
    NoEditorChange = False
    Me.TimerInterval = 0
    Me.cbPerson.SetFocus
    Exit Sub
  End If
  ' must be from persons or other call
  DidPersonAdd = False
  Me.TimerInterval = 0
  SendKeys "{TAB}"  '(vbCrLf) is bad, sometimes adds the characters in next field
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_NotInList(newdata As String, Response As Integer)
   ' If the person is not in the Persons Table then we need to add a record
   ' To the persons table using CurrentTP as type person.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If Person_NotInList(Me, "Other_Persons", CurrentTP, newdata, Response, _
            DidPersonAdd, True) = True Then
     If Response = acDataErrAdded Then ' Person added just as typed
         ' Focus will move to next object, no more work
     Else  ' Added diferent person (List selection) or had ';' in string
         ' Focus remains with cbPerson with new person selected.
         ' try to move on to next object with timer...
         ' Note in this case cbperson_BeforeAfter update not called so
         ' Must do any actions usally done there like:
         If IsNull(OP_TP) Then
           OP_TP = CurrentTP
         End If
         ' I will not check for duplicates in this case since unlikly a
         '  new person would already be in the otherpersons table.
         Me.TimerInterval = 50  '50  ' wait 50 milliseconds.  Should be
         ' enough for slower PCs (133 Mhz) since 1 Ms works for 833Mhz PC
     End If
   Else   ' failed to work or user canceled add..
     ' Origionally typed string still in combo box, user can edit or whatever!
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Dim tpstr As String
  If IsNull(CurrentTP) Then
    MsgBox "You Must Set Editor First"
    Cancel = True
    Exit Sub
  End If
  If Me.NewRecord = True Then
     OP_TP = CurrentTP
  End If
  ' get current persons.tp
  tpstr = IIf(IsNull(Me.TP), "", Me.TP)
  ' set to Current OtherPersons.TP if not set already
  Call setFieldTP(tpstr, CurrentTP)
  Me.TP = tpstr
  Me.LAST_CHG = Format(Now, "mm/dd/yy")
  'Me.J_LAST_CHG = Format(Now, "mm/dd/yy")
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_AfterUpdate()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   ' Can not change the person so no need to fix using call deletefixperson(..)
   Me.cbFindName.Requery
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Current()
   ' Important.  If a Delete is done while in a new record (or anytime actually)
   '   Form_Current is called.  This can cause wierd situations in the case the
   '   user does a delet while adding a new record. Me.NewRecord is set to
   '   false as soon as any data is entered in the form but so I can not
   '   always rely on that parameter to tell.  Anyway.   If a Delete is done
   '   while in a new record (even if me.NewRecord is False) Form_Current
   '   is called.  This causes big problems if I set any fields in Form_Current
   '   because then Me.NewRecord is set false and Access sees the data as
   '   a record and it must be completed before can move records etc.
   '  BOTTOM LINE.   DO NOT SET fields in Form_Current
   '                 DO NOt use code in Form_Current that will prevent a
   '                 Call to Form_AfterDeleteConfirm (I think setting fields)
   On Error GoTo SubError
   cbOP_TP.SetFocus  ' avoid error
   Me.Label_SandiaMS.Visible = False ' Used by Form_Dirty if is sandia person
   DirtyCount = 0
     Me.SCH_CODE.Visible = False
     Me.LbSch_code.Visible = False
     Me.cbSchool.Visible = False
     Me.LbSchool.Visible = False
     Me.Category.Visible = False
     Me.PAID.Visible = False
     Me.GRADE.Visible = False
     Me.Parent_or_Teacher.Visible = False
     
   If CurrentTP = "AS" Then
     Me.SCH_CODE.Visible = True
     Me.LbSch_code.Visible = True
     Me.cbSchool.Visible = True
     Me.LbSchool.Visible = True
   End If
   If CurrentTP = "TW" Then
     Me.Category.Visible = True
     Me.PAID.Visible = True
     Me.GRADE.Visible = True
     Me.Parent_or_Teacher.Visible = True
   End If
   If CurrentTP = "SW" Then
     Me.Category.Visible = True
     Me.PAID.Visible = True
     Me.GRADE.Visible = True
   End If
   If Me.NewRecord Then       '   -------------  NEW RECORD -----------------
     DidAdd = True ' Just used to Requery cbFindName
     Me.tbRecord = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.tbNumRec = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.cbPerson.Locked = False  ' Allow input of name
     'Me.cbPerson.SetFocus
   Else  '-----------EXISTING RECORD -----------------
     Me.cbPerson.Locked = True
     'Me.JUN.Locked = True       ' No Changes to JUN
     Me.tbNumRec = Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.tbRecord = Me.CurrentRecord
   End If   '                        -------   Current or New Record --------
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Delete(Cancel As Integer)
   ' This plus Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm work to ALWAYS show a delete message
   ' Even if user has turned off the warning messages.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   msg = "DELETE RECORD?"
   If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
      Cancel = True
      Exit Sub
   End If
   DidDelete = True   ' Indicate did a delete of the judge
   ' Can Not Delete the person yet because the judge Record Still Exists.
   ' This is due to Enforce Referential Integrity being set.
   ' So save the PID (person_ of the judge being deleted  so can ask later
   ' IMPORTANT:   IF we were in a new record (Even though me.NewRecord = False)
   ' Access now SETS NewRecord True and Form.Current is CALLED. This happens
   ' Before the Form_AfterDelete Confirm.  In Fact in some cases My Code in
   ' Form_Current can cause AfterDelConfirm to NOT BE CALLED.  This is true
   ' If the code in Form_Current sets any fields true (which then sets any
   ' autonumbers (like TID, STID...depending on which form and query)
   ' BEST to NOT SET FIELDS IN Form_Current
   DeletePID = Me.PID
   tOPID = Me.OPID
   tLNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me.LNAME), "", Me.LNAME)
   tFNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me.FNAME), "", Me.FNAME)
   Exit Sub  ' Judge record will be deleted on exit
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm(Cancel As Integer, Response As Integer)
   ' This suppresses the system confirmation message, I give message in
   ' Sub Form_Delete (
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Response = acDataErrContinue
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_AfterDelConfirm(STATUS As Integer)
  ' Use this to delete other related records (i.e. Persons) BUT,
  ' You must do :me.Application.SetOption "Confirm RecordChanges",True
  '   Or this Routine is NEVER CALLED!
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Call ScifairLog("Del OtherPersons OPID: ", tOPID, " " & tLNAME & ", " & tFNAME)
   If DeletePID <> 0 Then '  judge delted,  see if want to delete Person
    Call DeleteFixPerson(DeletePID, CurrentTP)
   End If
'     criteria = "SELECT * FROM Persons"
'     Set dbSciFair = CurrentDb()
'     Set personsRS = dbSciFair.OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
'     With personsRS
'       .FindFirst "PID = " & DeletePID
'       If .NoMatch Then
'         ' do nothing, not even there?
'       Else  ' Ask if want to delete person
'          Dim Name As String
'          Name = IIf(IsNull(!LNAME), "", !LNAME) & ", " & _
'          IIf(IsNull(!FNAME), "", !FNAME) & " " & _
'          IIf(IsNull(!MI), "", !MI) & " " & _
'          IIf(IsNull(!SALUTATION), "", !SALUTATION) & "  (" & _
'          IIf(IsNull(!TP), "", !TP) & ")"
'          If MsgBox(Name & vbCrLf & "Delete PERSON?", _
'                     vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, title) = vbYes Then
'            .Delete
'            Call ScifairLog(" Del Person PID: ", DeletePID, " " & Name)
'          End If
'       End If
'       .Close
'     End With
'     DeletePID = 0
'   End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  DeletePID = 0
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Load()
  ' The next statements give a type mismatch error unless or until
  ' I fixed the priority of references in the Visual Basic Tools option.
  ' Sequence must be:
  ' Visual Basic for Applications
  ' Microsoft Access 9.0 Library
  ' Microsoft Office 9.0 Library
  ' OLE Automation
  ' Microsoft DAO 3.6 Obj Lib
  ' Microsoft Visual Basic of Application Extensibility 5.3
  '  Others as needed
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Me.cbOP_TP.SetFocus
  Title = "OtherPersons Edit"
  ' This is Required If any Work is done in me.AfterDeleteConfirm_Click Action
  HoldCRCState = Me.Application.GetOption("Confirm Record Changes")
  Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", True
  DidDelete = False
  DeletePID = 0
  DidAdd = False
  NoEditorChange = False
  Me.Rev.Caption = RevisionDate
  On Error GoTo no_LastOtherPersonTypeProperty
  CurrentTP = CurrentDb().Properties("LastOtherPersonType")
  GoTo foundit
no_LastOtherPersonTypeProperty:
    Dim db As DAO.Database
    Dim prop As DAO.Property
    Set db = CurrentDb()
    Set prop = db.CreateProperty("LastOtherPersonType", dbText, "AS")
    db.Properties.Append prop
    'MsgBox "Be Sure to Select OtherPersons Type First"
    Resume ' same line that caused the error
foundit:
  On Error GoTo SubError
' next three MUST BE Before me.filter and me.filteron = true
  Me.cbOP_TP.SetFocus
  Me.cbOP_TP = CurrentTP
  Me.lblType.Caption = Me.cbOP_TP.Text & " Edit, Add, Delete"
  
  Me.Filter = "OP_TP = '" & CurrentTP & "'"
  Me.FilterOn = True 'causes a call to form.current
  ' recordcount is that from previous forms filter? so...
  DirtyCount = 0
  MsgBox "Remember to Select the Editor YOU WANT TO USE"
  If Not Me.Recordset.EOF Then
    Me.Recordset.MoveLast  ' populate to set record count
    Me.Recordset.MoveFirst
  Else
    MsgBox "No Entries for Person Type " & CurrentTP & vbCrLf & _
          "Enter First person now OR.. select different Editor"
  End If
  Me.tbNumRec = Me.Recordset.RecordCount ' required if new type diff last type
  Me.LbOTH_NAME.Caption = Me.cbOP_TP.Column(2)
  Me.LbOPType.Caption = Me.cbOP_TP.Column(1) & " Persons Information"
  Me.cbFindName.Requery
  If CurrentTP = "AS" Then
    Me.cbSchool.SetFocus
  Else
    Me.OTH.SetFocus
  End If
  Me.cbOP_TP = Null
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Close()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", HoldCRCState
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub


Private Sub TP_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   On Error GoTo SubError
  Dim tpstr As String
  tpstr = IIf(IsNull(Me.TP), "", Me.TP)
  Call setFieldTP(tpstr, "TH")
  Me.TP = tpstr
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub STATE_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[STATE]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[STATE], UCase(Me.[STATE]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[STATE] = UCase(Me.[STATE])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub MAILPREF_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[MAILPREF]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If Asc(Me.[MAILPREF]) <> Asc(UCase(Me.[MAILPREF])) Then ' do only not ucase
        Me.[MAILPREF] = UCase(Me.[MAILPREF])
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub


Private Function IsSandia() As Boolean
      On Error GoTo SubError
      Dim s1 As Integer
      Dim s2 As Integer
      Dim s3 As Integer
      Dim s4 As Integer
      s1 = 0: s2 = 0: s3 = 0: s4 = 0
      If Not IsNull(Me.ADDR1) Then
        s1 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR1], "5800")
        s2 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR1], "Sandia")
      End If
      If Not IsNull(Me.ADDR2) Then
        s3 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR2], "5800")
        s4 = InStr(1, Me.[ADDR2], "Sandia")
      End If
      If (s1 > 0 Or s3 > 0) And (s2 > 0 Or s4 > 0) Then
         Me.Label_SandiaMS.Visible = True
         IsSandia = True
      End If
      Exit Function
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Function
Private Sub ZIP_Enter()
    On Error GoTo SubError
    Dim test1 As Boolean
    test1 = IsSandia
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Dirty(Cancel As Integer)
  ' Goes here if ANY change is done to the record
  ' Do not know why but calls this 500 or more times on the
  ' First occasion of dirty.  ???  This is why the DirtyCount is used.
  ' Set DirtyCount = 0 on Form_Current Event
  ' Pressing [Esc] Twice will reset all fields including these below
    On Error GoTo SubError
    Dim test1 As Boolean
    If DirtyCount = 0 Then ' Do this only once, first edit after current
      test1 = IsSandia
      DirtyCount = 1  ' must do before next as they cause a new
                      ' call to dirty
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnFirst_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acFirst
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnFirst_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnFirst_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnFirst_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnPrev_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnPrev_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnPrev_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnPrev_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnNext_Click
    If Me.CurrentRecord = Me.Recordset.RecordCount Then
       MsgBox "End of Data!"
       ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
    End If
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNext
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnNext_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnNext_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnNext_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnLast_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acLast
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnLast_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnLast_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnLast_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnAdd_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnAdd_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNewRec
    Me.cbPerson.SetFocus
Exit_btnAdd_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnAdd_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnAdd_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnDelete_Click
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 8, , acMenuVer70
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 6, , acMenuVer70
      ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnDelete_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnDelete_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnDelete_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_Click()
    Dim svOPID As Long
    On Error GoTo Err_btnSave_Click
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, acSaveRecord, , acMenuVer70
    svOPID = Me.OPID
    ' The next command does a Remove Filter Sort which in effect requeries
    'DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, 3, , acMenuVer70 'RemFiltSort
    Me.Requery
    Me.Recordset.FindFirst "OPID = " & svOPID
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnSave_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnSave_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnSave_Click
End Sub
